instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP1V05_S5: What is PP1V05_S5? PP1V05_S5 is a 1.05v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. On 2008-2009 15” and 17” Macbook boards, this often gets stuck at 0.3v due to a bad C7771 capacitor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message:
Hi i have  this board and I replaced a <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> which had a low PPBUS now I have 12.56v I found the I was missing <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5</SIGNAL> so I check <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> area and all measurements where spot on I replaced <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and now the fan spins for 10-15 secs I went over the rails in diode mode and none are shorted :/ also no cpu activity with mouse And .859v at cpu. I removed heat sink think maybe no thermal paste but it was fine. All rails are fluctuating expect “PPBUS, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>” these 3 are stable. A tiny bit of water damage was on the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but that’s it. Here’s a video it’s weird because sometimes it’s spins longer than others. 

[MEDIA=youtube]hfVgjdQI4Ms[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message:
Did you check if all power rails come on in these 10-15s?
Don't forget pages 71/72.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Yes I checked them while fan was spinning all voltages and seem normal for the few seconds of fan spin but abruptly get cut of :/ I will check those pages 71/72 thanks for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Also test it starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Smc bypass does the same it doesn’t seem to respond to bypass

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: I tried with a clean bios and it has the same issue :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Board still turns off, if you remove DDR modules?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Yes with memory modules removed same issue. it seems that even though I get ALLSYSPWRGD it powers back down it’s like I loose all my enable signals at once

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message:
Heat BGA chips with quality flux.
Maybe be a problem caused by accumulated crap.
If still the same, pass the board through ultrasonic bath too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message:
Ok I finally got back to this board. I don’t have ultrasonic :( I didn’t heaT anything as of yet. i replaced <CAPACITOR>C8074</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> and some other parts. I’ve enclosed a image of the area they didn’t look quite right Cracks and loose.  I plugged it in and fans spin normally
I powered it down and connect mouse and speaker had both cpu activity, chime. I tried to install in a chassis and now it won’t chime and it started 3 beeps I’ve tried cleaning the slot, ram and even different ram. Sooo im Stuck :

I measures around and vcore is around 1.04v but doesn’t drop down from there and at Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5440</RESISTOR> the voltage goes up to 500mv then drops to 99mv. Is this line supposed to be 1.5v? there’s no short here .620 diode mode and <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> is 1.5v stable. Fans spin full speed even though both cpu, gpu Thermal sensors are good. Lastly the Mouse no longer flashing quickly it just blinks every few seconds the after a minute the board shuts down. Check cpu/gpu for thermal paste and it fresh.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message:
Test the board alone on the desk again.
If works, then try connecting one device at a time and testing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 10-15 seconds no cpu activity
threads.message: Yes I’ve done this it still does the same :/ with nothing connected just magesafe and also with just the battery.
